0: Buy Photo Chillicothe Police (Photo: Frank Robertson/Gazette, Frank Robertson/Gazette)Buy Photo NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR CHILLICOTHE - Chillicothe police have assisted in getting the mother who gave birth in Burger King on Friday into drug treatment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police issued a brief news release on Thursday that community outreach officer Bud Lytle had gotten Elizabeth D. Sanders, 26, into treatment. Lytle has worked for about 18 months as a liaison with those looking for drug treatment, especially those who have come into contact with law enforcement. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: Halting death: Police, sheriff become liaisons to treatment NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR More: Chillicothe baby born in toilet at Burger King NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sanders was arrested on a theft warrant after her release from the hospital. When police and medics found her in a Burger King stall, a ball of heroin allegedly was found on the floor beside her. The baby, found to have been born into the toilet bowl, is expected to be OK. Citing confidentiality, a children services representative said she could not provide any details on investigations.
